excerpt: Late Medieval church with a Victorian Gothic interior by Sir George Gilbert Scott, plus tower tours.
detail_description: Bath Abbey is a late Medieval church with a Victorian Gothic interior designed by Sir George Gilbert Scott. The site has been a place of worship for over 1,000 years and boasts spectacular features such as the decorative ladders of angels on the West Front, inspired by Bishop Oliver King's dream. The magnificent Victorian Gothic interior includes a soaring vaulted stone ceiling above the nave, added by Scott in the 1860s.
name: Bath Abbey
address: Bath, BA1 1LT, United Kingdom

excerpt: Roman bathhouse & temple with spring water, Pump Room restaurant, museum & audio tour for kids.
detail_description: The Roman Baths in Bath is a historical site featuring a well-preserved bathhouse and temple with natural spring water. Visitors can explore the museum and enjoy an audio tour designed for kids, immersing them in interactive ancient history. The site offers family-friendly activities including age-specific trails and a children's audioguide narrated by Michael Rosen. Additionally, the Pump Room restaurant within the complex provides an elegant dining experience with a dedicated children's menu.
name: The Roman Baths
address: Abbey Churchyard, Bath, BA1 1LZ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Small museum chronicling the life & times of the famous writer Jane Austen, plus a Regency tearoom.
detail_description: The Jane Austen Centre, located on historic Gay Street in Bath, is a small museum dedicated to the life and times of the renowned writer. Visitors can explore the well-preserved former townhome with a period-costumed guide and view various displays and materials related to Austen's time in Bath. The city itself was a popular destination for the upper classes during Austen's era due to its famous baths, rural setting, and vibrant social scene.
name: The Jane Austen Centre
address: 40 Gay St, Bath, BA1 2NT, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Royal Crescent is part of a collection of historic terraces and buildings in the city, including Queen Square, the Circus, Lansdown Crescent, and more. The Assembly Rooms were destroyed during an air raid in 1942 but have since been reconstructed and now house the Fashion Museum. Visitors can enjoy the location for free and it's perfect for a morning stroll or afternoon picnic. The area offers stunning views of historic architecture and leads to Royal Victoria Park.
name: The Royal Crescent
address: Bath, BA1 2LR, UK

excerpt: Historic bridge built in 1774 with notable architecture & rows of stores lining each side.
detail_description: Pulteney Bridge, constructed in 1774 by Robert Adam, is a picturesque and historic landmark in Bath. It spans the River Avon and is adorned with rows of shops on both sides, reminiscent of Venice's Rialto. The bridge's notable architecture, designed in a symmetrical Palladian style during the Georgian era, makes it a popular destination for sightseers and photographers alike. Its location offers stunning views from Parade Bridge, Parade Gardens, and the weir.
name: Pulteney Bridge
address: Bridge St, Bath, BA2 4AT, United Kingdom

excerpt: National Trust gardens overlooking Bath with follies, Palladian bridges, lakes and woodland.
detail_description: Located on the outskirts of Bath, England, Prior Park Landscape Garden is a picturesque National Trust site created in the 18th century by Ralph Allen. The garden offers stunning views of the city and features a Palladian bridge, three large lakes, and diverse plant specimens. It's a popular spot for romantic outings and even weddings. Accessible via the city's bus network or through the Skyline route, it's an ideal destination to explore while visiting Bath.
name: National Trust - Prior Park Landscape Garden (no parking)
address: Ralph Allen Dr, Bath, BA2 5AH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Modern glass-&-stone spa with thermal waters, Roman origins & an open rooftop swimming pool.
detail_description: Thermae Bath Spa is a modern spa that offers the unique experience of bathing in natural hot-spring water, including an open-air rooftop pool. Designed by Nicholas Grimshaw, the complex features a striking combination of Bath-stone and glass architecture. Visitors can choose between the sleekly luxurious Minerva Bath with its gentle currents or the smaller rooftop pool offering views of Bath's skyline, especially atmospheric at twilight.
name: Thermae Bath Spa
address: The Hetling Pump Room, Hot Bath St, Bath BA1 1SJ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Victorian collection of ornate silver and Old Masters in a Georgian building with modern extension.
detail_description: The Holburne Museum, located at the top of Great Pulteney Street in Bath, is a grand Georgian building with a modern extension. It houses an impressive collection of Victorian ornate silver and Old Masters. The museum also features Renaissance treasures, Gainsborough masterpieces, and 18th-century eclectica. Visitors can enjoy exhibitions of both ancient and modern art in elegant surroundings.
name: The Holburne Museum
address: Great Pulteney St, Bathwick, Bath BA2 4DB, United Kingdom

excerpt: Museum celebrating the Herschel's astronomic achievements in his Georgian former house and workshop.
detail_description: The Herschel Museum of Astronomy, located in the former home of astronomer William Herschel in Bath, celebrates his astronomical achievements. Visitors can explore the Georgian house and workshop where Herschel lived and made his famous discovery of the planet Uranus. The museum offers a glimpse into 18th-century life with restored rooms featuring period furniture and replicas of Herschel's astronomical equipment.
name: Herschel Museum of Astronomy
address: 19 New King St, Bath, BA1 2BL, United Kingdom

excerpt: Historical and contemporary European and British artworks including Bath artists and Gainsborough.
detail_description: The Victoria Art Gallery in Bath is a must-visit for art enthusiasts, featuring both historical and contemporary European and British artworks, including pieces by local artists and Gainsborough. The gallery is housed in a splendid Victorian setting and offers a diverse collection of decorative art with continually changing temporary exhibitions. Additionally, the gallery hosts engaging events, trails, and workshops for kids. Visitors can also explore nearby attractions such as the Holburne Museum and Beckford's Tower for a comprehensive cultural experience in the city.
name: Victoria Art Gallery
address: Bridge St, Bath, BA2 4AT, United Kingdom

excerpt: Museum of American arts & heritage with gardens, valley views & special exhibitions, plus a play area & a cafe.
detail_description: The American Museum & Gardens, located around 2 miles east of Bath, is a captivating destination for visitors worldwide. Housed in an impressive 18th-century mansion, it showcases impeccable reconstructions of 19th-century American family homes and a vast collection of American folk and decorative arts, crafts, and textiles. The museum also features stunning gardens with a dedicated Children's Garden for young ones to explore nature and American culture.
name: American Museum & Gardens
address: Claverton Manor, Claverton Down, Bath BA2 7BD, United Kingdom

excerpt: Sprawling Victorian parklands with lawns, skate park, playgrounds, boating and tennis.
detail_description: Royal Victoria Park Bath is a vast 57-acre Victorian park located just a short walk from the city center. It offers various attractions such as a duck pond, bandstand, cafes, and refreshment kiosks. The park also features amenities like crazy golf, tennis courts, and an extensive adventure playground with a skatepark. Visitors can enjoy hot air balloon tours from the meadows to the north of the park and participate in annual events like Bath on the Beach and Bath on Ice.
name: Royal Victoria Park Bath
address: Marlborough Ln, Bath, BA1 2NQ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Fashionable dress from 1600 to now, plus Victorian clothing & old sports costumes to try on.
detail_description: The Fashion Museum Bath, located in the northern part of the city near the Georgian Circus, offers a captivating journey through fashion history. Housed in the lower floor of the Assembly Rooms, it showcases iconic styles from different eras, including Victorian clothing and sports costumes. With over 160 dressed figures spanning 400 years of history, visitors can explore garments ranging from a 17th-century shirt to contemporary designs by renowned designers like Jean-Paul Gaultier and John Galliano.
name: Fashion Museum Bath
address: Assembly Rooms, Bennett St, Bath BA1 2QH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Landmark route featuring a circle of grand, Georgian townhouses, built in the mid-1700s.
detail_description: The Circus is a famous landmark in Bath, England, known for its circle of grand Georgian townhouses built in the mid-1700s. It is part of a collection of historic terraces and individual buildings that adorn the city, including Queen Square, Royal Crescent, and Lansdown Crescent. The Assembly Rooms were destroyed during an air raid in 1942 but have since been reconstructed and now house the Fashion Museum.
name: The Circus
address: Bath, UK

excerpt: Plush red & gold Georgian playhouse with tiered seating & a painted ceiling, plus backstage tours.
detail_description: The Theatre Royal, Bath is a stunning Georgian playhouse adorned with plush red and gold décor. It was built in 1805 and is considered one of the most important examples of Georgian theatre architecture. Over the years, it has hosted performances by renowned actors and continues to captivate audiences with a diverse range of entertainment including drama, West End productions, opera, comedy, and dance across its three auditoriums.
name: Theatre Royal, Bath
address: Saw Cl, Bath, BA1 1ET, United Kingdom

excerpt: Bath is a city in Somerset, England, known for and named after its Roman-built baths. At the 2021 census, the population was 94,092. Bath is in the valley of the River Avon, 97 miles west of London and 11 miles southeast of Bristol. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Bath, a city in Somerset, England, is famous for its Roman-built baths and is home to a population of 94,092. Situated in the picturesque valley of the River Avon, it's located 97 miles west of London and 11 miles southeast of Bristol. The area has gained attention with notable establishments like Babington House and At the Chapel in Bruton, as well as the contemporary art gallery Hauser & Wirth.
name: Bath
address: UK

excerpt: Classical music accompaniment to coffee, lunch and afternoon tea overlooking Roman Baths hot spring.
detail_description: The Pump Room Restaurant is a sophisticated venue in Bath, offering classical music accompaniment to coffee, lunch, and afternoon tea with a view of the Roman Baths hot spring. Originally constructed to provide public access to thermal waters in the late 17th century for medicinal purposes, it still houses the Kings Spring water fountain where visitors can purchase a glass of warm spa water. The elegant interior features grand columns, beautiful chandeliers, and stylish Georgian decor that reflects the high society of its time.
name: The Pump Room Restaurant
address: Searcys at the Pump Room, Stall St, Bath BA1 1LZ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Bath's oldest house (c.1483), home of the famous Sally Lunn Bun (a semi-sweet bread) and tearoom.
detail_description: Sally Lunn’s Historic Eating House & Museum is located in Bath, and it's known for being the city's oldest house, dating back to around 1483. The house is famous for its association with the creation of the Sally Lunn Bun, a semi-sweet bread that has become a local delicacy. Legend has it that Sally Lunn, a Huguenot refugee, introduced this brioche-style bun to a baker in Bath in 1680.
name: Sally Lunn’s Historic Eating House & Museum
address: 4 N Parade Passage, Bath, BA1 1NX, United Kingdom

excerpt: Hilltop views of city rooftops & World Heritage site accessed via a 6-mile meadow & woodland trail.
detail_description: Bath Skyline offers stunning hilltop views of the city rooftops and is a World Heritage site that can be accessed via a 6-mile trail through meadows and woodlands. The route takes you through various landscapes, including meadows, woodlands, 18th-century follies, secluded valleys, ancient Roman settlements, and an Iron Age fort. Starting from Bathwick Hill, the 6-mile circular trail provides breathtaking views over Bath with various viewpoints along the way.
name: Bath Skyline
address: Bathwick Hill, Bath, BA2 6EN, United Kingdom

excerpt: 18th-century Palladian-style townhouse featuring elaborate period room displays & fine art.
detail_description: No. 1 Royal Crescent is an 18th-century Palladian-style townhouse that has been transformed into a museum, offering visitors a glimpse into life during the Regency period in Bath. The museum features elaborate period room displays and fine art, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the Georgian era. Through restored townhouse furnishings and a soundscape of imagined conversations between family members and staff, visitors can gain insight into the concerns and lifestyle of that time.
name: No. 1 Royal Crescent
address: 1 Royal Cres, Bath, BA1 2LR, United Kingdom

excerpt: Collection of Asian ceramics, jades and bronzes across 5 galleries in a Georgian building.
detail_description: The Museum of East Asian Art is a place where visitors can explore an eclectic collection of East and Southeast Asian art. The museum is located in a renovated Georgian house, and its current exhibitions range from Japanese mens fashion to Netsuke sash-fastenings.
name: The Museum of East Asian Art
address: 12 Bennett St, Bath, BA1 2QJ, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Bath Assembly Rooms, designed by the renowned architect John Wood, are a set of Grade 1 listed buildings in Bath. They have become a popular attraction for the public. Visitors can enjoy informative tours and gain insights into the exquisite chandeliers. It is advisable to make advance bookings for an enhanced experience.
name: Assembly Rooms
address: Bath, BA1 2QJ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Built in 1795, this 12-acre landscaped park with a canal is a scenic place for picnics & recreation.
detail_description: Sydney Gardens, a 12-acre park established in 1795, offers picturesque landscapes and recreational opportunities. The area is adorned with over 140 historic terraces and buildings, including notable structures like Queen Square, the Circus, the Royal Crescent, and Lansdown Crescent. Additionally, visitors can explore the pavilion housing the art collection of the Holburne Museum.
name: Sydney Gardens
address: Sydney Pl, Bathwick, Bath, BA2 4DB, United Kingdom

excerpt: This museum in a Gothic revival chapel offers exhibits on city history, including a scale model.
detail_description: The Museum of Bath Architecture, located in a Gothic revival chapel, offers an insightful exploration of the city's architectural history. Visitors can immerse themselves in exhibits showcasing the transformation of Bath from a medieval town to a renowned Georgian city. The museum features an array of historical maps, models, designs, drawings, videos, paintings and tools that vividly narrate how 18th-century architects and craftsmen contributed to this remarkable evolution.
name: Museum of Bath Architecture
address: The Countess of Huntingdon’s Chapel, The Paragon, The Vineyards, Bath, BA1 5NA, United Kingdom

excerpt: Bucolic, 37-acre farm featuring chickens, goats & pigs, plus a cafe, trails & community events.
detail_description: Bath City Farm is a charming 37-acre pastoral oasis located just a short distance from the city center. This working farm is home to a variety of friendly animals such as Shetland ponies, pygmy goats, sheep, pigs, ducks, cows and chickens. Visitors can enjoy nature hunts and trails that lead through fields, meadows and woodlands with picturesque views of Bath. The farm also features a delightful children's playground and an amphitheater for community events.
name: Bath City Farm
address: Kelston View, Whiteway, Bath BA2 1NW, United Kingdom

excerpt: Park with lawns and flower beds, plus a cafe and a bandstand with summer concerts. Open Apr-Sep.
detail_description: Bath City Parade Gardens is a picturesque park featuring lush lawns, vibrant flower beds, and a charming cafe. The gardens also boast a bandstand that hosts summer concerts from April to September. Designed by the renowned Georgian architect John Wood the Elder, this scenic spot offers visitors the perfect setting for picnics or leisurely breaks.
name: Bath City Parade Gardens
address: Grand Parade, Bath, BA2 4DF, United Kingdom

detail_description: Mary Shelley's House of Frankenstein is a museum and immersive visitor attraction located in Bath, where Mary Shelley wrote the first science fiction novel, Frankenstein, in 1816. The four-story historic property offers an award-winning experience that delves into Shelley's unconventional life and the enduring legacy of her infamous creation. Visitors can explore vintage artifacts, experience the sounds and smells of the Frankenstein era, and encounter an 8-foot animatronic representation of the iconic monster as described by Mary Shelley.
name: Mary Shelley's House of Frankenstein
address: 37 Gay St, Bath, BA1 2NT, United Kingdom

excerpt: Built in 1789, this wide boulevard is lined with Georgian buildings & terminates at a fountain.
detail_description: Great Pulteney Street is a grand boulevard in Bath, lined with Georgian buildings and terminating at a fountain. It was built in 1789 and designed by architect Thomas Baldwin. The street offers picturesque views of Sydney Place, Bath street, cobbled alleyways, Abbey Green, Sydney Gardens, Widcombe Terrace, The Circus, Royal Crescent and St Marys Buildings. Dukes Bath on Great Pulteney Street provides lodgings with period antiques and complimentary breakfast.
name: Great Pulteney St
address: Bathwick, Bath, UK

excerpt: Elegant 18th-century Ball Room plus the Octagon, Tea Room and Card Room with marble and chandeliers.
detail_description: The National Trust - Bath Assembly Rooms offers a glimpse into the opulent lifestyle of the 18th century elite. Designed by John Wood the Younger, these rooms were at the heart of Bath's social scene, hosting dances, card games, and tea gatherings. The Fashion Museum housed within adds to its allure. Frequented by renowned figures like Jane Austen, it remains a time capsule of history where visitors can immerse themselves in the lavish past.
name: National Trust - Bath Assembly Rooms
address: Bennett St, Bath, BA1 2QH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Bath stone 19th century indoor market with deli, confectionery, pet supply & book stalls & a café.
detail_description: Bath Guildhall Market is a historic indoor market located in Bath, made of Bath stone and dating back 800 years. It features over a dozen permanent traders offering a variety of goods such as food items, artisanal products, jewelry, fashion accessories, and household items. The market's 19th-century covered domes create a charming atmosphere for visitors to explore the stalls selling everything from confectionery to souvenirs.
name: Bath Guildhall Market
address: Guildhall Market, Bath, BA2 4AW, United Kingdom

excerpt: Small collection of artifacts, exhibits & mail tracing the history of the British postal service.
detail_description: The Bath Postal Museum, located in the basement of 27 Northgate Street in central Bath, is a small yet unique museum that showcases a collection of artifacts and exhibits tracing the history of the British postal service. Although currently closed, it is set to reopen soon and offers visitors an opportunity to learn about Bath's significant role in shaping the UK postal service during the 19th century.
name: Bath Postal Museum
address: Northgate Yd, 27 Northgate St, Bath BA1 1AJ, United Kingdom

excerpt: 18th-century thoroughfare with stately townhouses now housing various clothing shops & eateries.
detail_description: Milsom St is an 18th-century thoroughfare in Bath, lined with elegant townhouses that now host a variety of clothing shops and eateries. It forms one of the main city center streets and is surrounded by upscale high street shops like LK Bennett, Anthropologie, Ted Baker, and Reiss. Additionally, it features tempting cosmetics and fragrance brands such as Jo Malone and Keihls.
name: Milsom St
address: Bath, UK

excerpt: Built in 1827, this restored neoclassical tower with a spiral staircase offers scenic views & art.
detail_description: Beckford's Tower and Museum, a neoclassical tower built in 1827, offers scenic views and art. It was commissioned by William Beckford as a place of tranquility away from society. The tower houses Beckford's furniture, paintings, prints, books, and other interesting objects related to his life in Georgian England. Visitors can climb the spiral staircase to the Belvedere for panoramic views.
name: Beckford's Tower and Museum
address: Lansdown Rd, Bath, BA1 9BH, United Kingdom

excerpt: Massive green grassy lawns next to the Royal Crescent with serene views of historic architecture.
detail_description: The Royal Crescent in Bath offers a picturesque setting with its massive green lawns and historic architecture. It is featured in the popular series Bridgerton, capturing the elegance of the era. Visitors can leisurely explore the city, taking in iconic sights like the Roman Baths and Prior Park. The row of 30 terraced houses built between 1767 and 1774 showcases remarkable Georgian architecture, with No.1 Royal Crescent now serving as a museum for visitors to experience its grandeur firsthand.
name: Royal Crescent
address: The Royal Crescent, Royal Cres, Bath BA1 2LX, United Kingdom

excerpt: Atmospheric club venue staging live comedy and music gigs, with a cinema, cafe-diner and gallery.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Bath, Komedia is a vibrant club venue that brings together the best of live entertainment. This community-owned gem, housed in a beautifully restored Grade II listed former cinema, hosts an impressive array of over 400 events each year. From side-splitting comedy and captivating music gigs to engaging cabaret shows and family-friendly activities, there's something for everyone at Komedia.
name: Komedia
address: 22-23 Westgate St, Bath, BA1 1EP, United Kingdom

detail_description: The City Sightseeing Bath Hop On Hop Off tour offers a convenient way to explore the major attractions of Bath. With two routes, the City Tour and the Bath Skyline Tour, visitors can easily hop on and off at 16 or 21 stops within a 24-hour period. This red open-top bus provides access to popular landmarks such as River Avon, Pulteney Bridge, Bath Abbey, Royal Crescent, and Abbey Cemetery.
name: City Sightseeing Bath Hop On Hop Off
address: 6 N Parade, Bath, BA1 1LF, United Kingdom

detail_description: The Bath Digital Festival is a week-long event that offers a diverse digital experience for people of all ages. It has been celebrated since 2013 and continues to grow in popularity. The festival features various activities, including music, literature, food, and film festivals throughout the year. Renowned artists from different art fields participate in this wide-scale celebration held between late May and early June. This event promises an amazing experience for attendees as it enters its fifth year in 2017.
name: Bath Digital Festival
address: Newark Works, 2 Foundry Ln, Bath BA2 3DZ, United Kingdom

detail_description: FilmBath, previously known as Bath Film Festival, is a highly anticipated cultural event in the city of Bath. The festival has been showcasing an array of brilliant films for over a decade, offering a diverse selection that includes movies not typically screened in the area. With its commitment to providing access to cinematic gems, FilmBath offers discounted tickets for under 30s and significant concession prices, making it an inclusive and accessible cultural experience.
name: FilmBath previously Bath Film Festival
address: 4 Chapel Row, Bath, BA1 1HN, United Kingdom

detail_description: Alexandra Park is a serene and picturesque spot located in Somerset County, England. Situated at the top of Beechen Cliff hill, this park offers spectacular panoramic views of the beautiful city of Bath. To reach the park, visitors can take a steep walk up Jacobs Ladder or hike Beechen Cliff hill for an off-the-beaten-path experience. The lush greenery and lookout points in Alexandra Park provide stunning vistas of Bath's famous landmarks, including Bath Abbey and the Royal Crescent.
name: Alexandra Park
address: Bath, UK

excerpt: Landmark architecture & thermal baths distinguish this renowned street with limited modern signage.
detail_description: Bath Street is a renowned location known for its landmark architecture and thermal baths. The street connects two hot springs, blending modern and ancient elements. Flanked by houses from the late 1700s, it stands out for its lack of modern signage and traffic, making it a popular choice for movie locations. The cobbled street with column-lined buildings offers picturesque views perfect for social media or film sets. With its timeless charm and historical significance, Bath Street is a must-visit destination in Bath.
name: Bath St
address: Bath, UK

excerpt: Family-run pub serving real ales, and local pies at big wooden tables inside 2 Georgian townhouses.
detail_description: If you find yourself wandering through the charming streets of Bath, make sure to stop by The Raven, a delightful family-run pub that beautifully captures the essence of British hospitality. Recently renovated in 2023, this inviting establishment spans multiple floors and features various bars, including a cozy library on the top floor for those seeking a quieter atmosphere. Known for its mouthwatering pies and an ever-changing selection of local ales, The Raven is not just about food and drink; it’s about community.
name: The Raven
address: 7 Queen St, Bath, BA1 1HE, United Kingdom

detail_description: Nestled in the charming city of Bath, Electric Bear Brewing Co stands out as a premier destination for craft beer enthusiasts. Established in 2015, this independent brewery operates from Brassmill Trading Estate and offers an impressive selection of ten unique craft beers at their Taproom, open Thursday through Sunday. Visitors can savor everything from refreshing ales to bold IPAs, all brewed on-site with creativity and passion.
name: Electric Bear Brewing Co | Bath
address: Unit 12, The Maltings Industrial Estate, 7 Brassmill Ln, Bath BA1 3JL, United Kingdom

excerpt: This small garden is designed in the geometric style of the late 1700s, with box hedges & topiaries.
detail_description: The Georgian Garden is a small, meticulously designed garden located in the heart of Bath, England. It features a geometric layout typical of the late 1700s, complete with box hedges and topiaries. The garden successfully recreates an authentic 18th-century back garden and is filled with traditional plants and flowers. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll through this formal garden, taking in its simple yet elegant design.
name: Georgian Garden
address: Bath, BA1 2EW, United Kingdom

excerpt: Glassblowing studio with interactive demonstrations & a gift shop with colourful products for sale.
detail_description: Bath Aqua Glass Glassblowing Studio is an independent glass production company located on Walcot Street, specializing in handmade fused glass jewelry, unique gifts, and glassware decorations. The studio offers public glass blowing demonstrations and courses, as well as activities for hen parties and a wedding glassware collection. Visitors can also try their hand at glass blowing by reserving a spot for an interactive session.
name: Bath Aqua Glass Glassblowing Studio
address: 105-107 Walcot St, Bath, BA1 5BW, United Kingdom

excerpt: Green space with scenic city views, mature trees, picnicking, a playground & more.
detail_description: Alexandra Park, located in Bath, North-East Somerset, England, is a picturesque green space offering stunning panoramic views of the city and surrounding countryside. Situated at the top of Beechen Cliff, this elevated parkland features mature trees, pathways, seating areas, and a playground for children. Accessible by climbing a number of steps or via Holloway and Shakespeare Avenue, it's popular for picnics and leisurely strolls.
name: Alexandra Park
address: Shakespeare Ave, Bath, BA2 4RQ, United Kingdom

excerpt: Looking like a Medieval castle, this folly was built much later & is now illuminated at night.
detail_description: Sham Castle is a picturesque architectural folly resembling a medieval castle, built in 1762 by local entrepreneur Ralph Allen to enhance the view from his townhouse. Situated below the university campus on Bathwick Hill, it offers stunning vistas of Bath's towers and spires. Visitors can embark on a circular route from central Bath to Sham Castle, passing through woods and meadows while enjoying views of Prior Park and the American Museum.
name: Sham Castle
address: Golf Course Rd, Claverton Down, Bath BA2 6JG, United Kingdom

detail_description: Located near the iconic Pulteney Bridge in Bath, the Beazer Garden Maze offers a peaceful and enjoyable experience for visitors of all ages. Designed by Randoll Coate in 1984, this labyrinth draws inspiration from various historical eras that have influenced the city's heritage. While some may find it underwhelming compared to their expectations, others appreciate its unique design and historical influences.
name: Beazer Garden Maze
address: Spring Gardens Rd, Bathwick, Bath BA2 6PW, United Kingdom

excerpt: Quaint local market for crafts, apparel, housewares & jewelry, plus baked goods & street eats.
detail_description: The Bath Artisan Market is a charming local market located in Queen Square, just a short walk from the Jane Austen Center. It's a beloved spot for locals and offers a variety of unique artisan products, including crafts, housewares, jewelry, baked goods, and street food. During the Christmas season, it transforms into a festive market with an array of holiday goodies.
name: Bath Artisan Market
address: Queen Square, Bath, BA1 2HA, United Kingdom

detail_description: Skyline Walk in Bath offers a 6-mile loop through the city's hills, showcasing meadows, forests, and secluded valleys. While some visitors found the signage confusing and were disappointed by the presence of a golf course impacting nature and economics, others appreciated the beauty of the forested areas. However, there were mixed reviews about expectations versus reality. Some found it difficult to locate the starting point while others simply enjoyed this beautiful place.
name: Skyline
address: Bathwick, Bath, UK
